column2: SOUTH DAKOTA DMV TEST
column4: South Dakota
column6: SD

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. This road sign means:
column4: Reduction in lanes
column6: Merge right
column8: Stop sign ahead

column2: 2. When driving at night, drivers should:
column4: increase their following distance.
column6: always use their high beams.
column8: look directly into the oncoming headlights of approaching vehicles.

column2: 3. What should drivers do when they see this sign?
column4: Make sure the bridge is clear of oncoming traffic before they cross.
column6: Allow others to merge smoothly.
column8: Look to the left and right for other traffic.

column2: 4. This road sign warns drivers that:
column4: vehicles must leave the pavement immediately.
column6: the road surface ahead changes to a low-type surface or earth road.
column8: the dirt on the side of the road is soft.

column2: 5. This road sign means:
column4: A road joins from the left
column6: You must bear either right or left
column8: A 3-way intersection is ahead

column2: 6. Before stopping your vehicle on the roadway, drivers should:
column4: place their foot on the accelerator.
column6: check their mirrors for traffic.
column8: pump the brakes to check if they work properly.

column2: 7. At intersections, crosswalks, and railroad crossings, drivers should always:
column4: stop, listen for oncoming traffic, and proceed with caution.
column6: slowly pass vehicles the vehicles ahead.
column8: look to the sides of their vehicle to see what is coming.

column2: 8. Large trucks:
column4: have high-tech air brakes which allow them to stop quickly.
column6: are more maneuverable than passenger vehicles.
column8: take longer to stop than passenger vehicles.

column2: 9. This road sign means:
column4: No left turn
column6: No U-turns
column8: No right turn

column2: 10. Blind spots are:
column4: At night, the darkest areas of a road, where emergency flashers should be used.
column6: Areas to the side or rear of a vehicle that the driver cannot see with use of mirrors.
column8: Dangerous intersection where the maximum speed limit is 15 MPH or less.

column2: 11. The only effective way to reduce your blood alcohol content (BAC) is:
column4: drinking coffee.
column6: not to drink over a period of time.
column8: fresh air.

column2: 12. When you see this sign you should:
column4: merge left.
column6: turn right.
column8: watch for traffic to the right.

column2: 13. This road sign means:
column4: Divided highway ahead
column6: Four-lane traffic ahead
column8: Two-way traffic ahead

column2: 14. After passing a vehicle, it is safe to return to your lane:
column4: after about five seconds.
column6: when you can no longer see the vehicle over your right shoulder.
column8: when you see the front bumper of the other vehicle in your mirror.

column2: 15. A vehicle is stopped at a crosswalk to permit a pedestrian to cross the roadway. The driver of the vehicle approaching from the rear should:
column4: overtake and pass the stopped vehicle.
column6: not overtake and pass the stopped vehicle.
column8: sound the horn.

column2: 16. This sign indicates that:
column4: trucks are merging from the right
column6: there's a side road ahead
column8: there is a steep hill ahead.

column2: 17. What should you do if your rear wheels start to skid?
column4: Turn the steering wheel in the direction the vehicle is trying to go.
column6: Steer left if your rear wheels slide right.
column8: If the vehicle has ABS, pump the pedal carefully.

column2: 18. What can you do to prevent skids on snow and ice?
column4: Brake early and gently.
column6: Allow the wheels to keep turning.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 19. Broken yellow lines:
column4: indicate you are in a no passing zone.
column6: separate lanes of traffic moving in the same direction.
column8: separate lanes of traffic moving in opposite directions.

column2: 20. If an emergency vehicle with flashing lights is traveling in the area where you are driving, you must:
column4: proceed slowly and let the vehicle pass.
column6: keep driving in your lane.
column8: drive to the right side of the road and stop.

column2: 21. While inside the roundabout, you should:
column4: change lanes before you check for vehicles behind you.
column6: remain in your lane until you are ready to exit.
column8: use your left turn signal if you are in position to exit now.

column2: 22. This sign means:
column4: The road will curve to the right.
column6: Left turns are not allowed at the intersection.
column8: Do not turn right.

column2: 23. A solid yellow line next to a broken yellow line means that vehicles:
column4: next to the solid line may pass.
column6: next to the broken line may pass.
column8: in both directions may pass.

column2: 24. If the vehicle you are driving starts to skid, you should:
column4: brake lightly.
column6: stay off the brakes.
column8: turn off the ignition.

column2: 25. This regulatory sign tells drivers that:
column4: traffic in the left lane must turn left at the intersection ahead.
column6: all vehicles must turn left immediately.
column8: traffic in the right lane must go straight.
